text: I have been wounded like this since about half past eight this morning and I will tell you how it happened.
author: Francesco Borromini

text: Secretary of State Colin Powell, thank you so much, as always, for joining us this morning.
author: Hannah Storm

text: 'Tis always morning somewhere in the world.
author: Richard Henry Horne

text: In the morning he was lying dead on one of the beds fully clothed. He was dead. I got the impression he wanted to go, and I must have killed him. I can't remember strangling him. I just sat there shocked.
author: Dennis Nilsen

text: I knew, however, that the next morning after the fight I would have to get away, and I did just in time, for a full company came early to look for me and were furious because I had escaped them.
author: Jesse James
